page.title: 06LEE MOOR-RETIRED POPULATION.
page.content: The population of Lee Moor has an above average retired population.This does present problems because of the relative isolation of Lee Moor village.For instance, the nearest doctor's surgery is in Wotter.If dental treatment is needed the people have to travel about five miles to Plympton.The nearest hospital is in Plymouth.There are two types of transport available.Some have access to a car,or there is a bus service. There is a shop in the village which sells food but it is only open in the morning and does not have the selection of a supermarket.If people want a wider selection of goods,they either have to travel to Plympton,or rely on a friend or relative to get it for them.There are a variety of clubs in the village which bring the older people together.
